title: The Grimethorpe Colliery Brass Band - Brassed Off
description:
Please, help seed! Don't hit and run!
Let me know what you think by a comment.

I had this album before in a better bitrate. But for some strange reason (maybe not for Bill Gates and Microsoft), my computer in its own wisdom decided to erase the folder.
I've searched the net and this is what I've found. For sensitive ears the bitrate of 128 may be inadequate. I've listened to it all and it sounds allright.
There is another torrent <a href="
http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/3348532/Brassed_Off_-_Grimethorpe_Colliery_Band" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/3348532/Brassed_Off_-_Grimethorpe_Colliery_Band</a>
wich seems to be in 160 bps. But we've got stuck on 73,9% download for quite some time there.
So, this is better than nothing.
I had some problems in sorting out the tracklisting but I think it's correct now. If you find any errors, please let me know.


Brassed Off - Original Soundtrack @128

01  Death or Glory (Robert Browne Hall)
02  Sad Old Day (Trevor Jones)
03  Floral Dance (Katie Moss)
04  Aforementioned Essential Items (Trevor Jones)
05  En Aranjuez con Tu Amor (Joaquin Rodrigo) Solo flugel - Paul Hughes
06  Years of Coal (Trevor Jones)
07  March of the Cobblers (Bob Barrett and Edrich Siebert)
08  There's More Important Things in Life (Trevor Jones)
09  Cross of Honour (William Rimmer)
10  Jerusalem (Sir Charles Hubert Hastings Parry/Lyrics William Blake)
11  Florentiner March (Julius Fucik)
12  Danny Boy (Londonderry Air) (Percy Grainger)
13  We'll Find a Way (Trevor Jones)
14  Clog Dance (John Marcangelo)
15  Colonel Bogey (Kenneth Alford)
16  All Things Bright and Beautiful (William H Monk/Lyrics Cecil F Alexander)
17  William Tell Overture (Gioacchino Rossini) Solo Cornet - Shaun Randall
18  Honest Decent Human Beings (Trevor Jones)
19  Pomp and Circumstance (Sir Edward Elgar)


Conducted by Trevor Jones. 
Orchestrations by Trevor Jones and Geoff Alexander. 
Performed by The Grimethorpe Colliery Band. Band Leader John Anderson. 
Featured musical soloists Maurice Murphy, Paul Hughes and Shaun Randall. 
Recorded and mixed by Mike Sheady and Simon Rhodes. 
Album produced by Trevor Jones.
